case_vignette:
A 32-year-old man comes to the office complaining of right-sided upper abdominal pain for about 2 weeks. He is also complaining of subjective fever and malaise for the same duration. He has never been out of the United States. Additionally, he describes several episodes of bloody diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain that resolved on their own a few months ago. Travel history is noncontributory. He has been sexually active with 3 male partners in the last year and uses a condom inconsistently. He was diagnosed with syphilis 4 months ago and was treated with a single shot of penicillin. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes per day for the last 10 years and drinks 1–2 beers a day. Temperature is 38.7°C (101.6°F), blood pressure is 137/78 mm Hg, pulse is 98/min, respirations are 14/min, and BMI is 22 kg/m2. On physical examination, his liver is tender and palpable 2 cm below the right costal margin.
Laboratory test
 Hemoglobin  15 g/dL
 Leucocyte and differential  
Leucocyte count  12,500/mm3
Neutrophil  60%
Lymphocyte  31%
Eosinophil  1%
 Liver function test 
 ALT   100 U/L
 AST  95 U/L
ALP 220 U/L
CT scan of the abdomen shows a single cystic lesion on the right lobe of the liver.
question: What is the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing right-sided upper abdominal pain for about 2 weeks, feel like I have a fever and just overall not well for the same amount of time.
Do you have any history of liver or gallbladder problems?
No, I don't have any history of liver or gallbladder problems.
Do you have any history of recent travel or exposure to someone with a similar illness?
I've never been out of the United States and don't have any significant travel history.
Got it. Have you experienced any change in your bowel habits or any yellowing of the skin or eyes?
I've had several episodes of bloody diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain a few months ago, but no yellowing of the skin or eyes.
Thank you for the information. Have you had any recent contact with anyone who has had similar symptoms?
No, I haven't had any contact with anyone who has similar symptoms.
Thank you for the information. Have you had any recent changes in your diet or started any new medications?
No, I haven't made any recent changes to my diet or started any new medications.
Do you have a family history of inflammatory bowel disease or any other gastrointestinal conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of inflammatory bowel disease or other gastrointestinal conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Acute Cholecystitis

trial_0.summarized_conversation: The patient reports experiencing right-sided upper abdominal pain for about 2 weeks, along with a feeling of fever and overall malaise for the same amount of time. The patient denies any history of liver or gallbladder problems, as well as any significant travel history. Several episodes of bloody diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain occurred a few months ago, but no jaundice was noted. The patient denies any recent contact with individuals exhibiting similar symptoms, changes to their diet, or the initiation of any new medications. Additionally, the patient has not mentioned any family history of inflammatory bowel disease or other gastrointestinal conditions.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having right-sided upper abdominal pain for about 2 weeks, feeling like I have a fever and just a general sense of feeling unwell during the same time.
Do you have any other symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, or yellowing of the skin and eyes?
No, I haven't had nausea, vomiting, or yellowing of the skin and eyes.
Can you tell me your age and sex, please?
I am a 32-year-old man.
Have you had any previous medical conditions or surgeries? Any family history of liver or gallbladder problems?
I was diagnosed with syphilis 4 months ago and treated with a shot of penicillin, but I haven't mentioned any other medical conditions, surgeries, or family history of liver or gallbladder problems.
Thank you for the information. Have you had any recent travel or potential exposure to contaminated food or water?
I have never been out of the United States and my travel history isn't relevant to my condition.
I understand. Do you consume alcohol regularly or have a history of heavy alcohol use?
I drink 1–2 beers a day.
Thank you for the information. Based on your symptoms, medical history, and alcohol consumption, I would recommend further testing. Have you had any recent blood tests or imaging for this problem?
Yes, I've had blood tests which showed a high white blood cell count and elevated liver enzymes, and a CT scan of the abdomen revealed a single cystic lesion on the right lobe of my liver.
**Final Diagnosis:** Pyogenic liver abscess
